Amend or renew a previously granted EPEA approval.
Amend or renew a previously granted EPEA approval for an electric power plant.

Syncrude Canada Ltd has submitted an application under the Environmental Protection and Enhancement Act for an amendment to an existing approval to expand the North Mine Triangle Reclamation Material Stockpile in Section 13-92-10-W4M.

Canadian Natural Resources Limited has submitted an application under the Environmental Protection and Enhancement Act for a renewal of an existing approval for the Ante Creek sour gas plant. The facility is located in LSD 10 of Section 18 Township 65 Range 23 West of the 5th Meridian (approximately 22 km northeast of Little Smoky) and operates as a battery only. The raw gas process capacity of the plant is 350  103 m3/day at 101.325 kPa and 15C, including raw
gas and condensate. The deadline for submitting a statement of concern is December 2, 2015.

Manitok Energy Inc. has submitted an application for an amendment under the Environmental Protection and Enhancement Act to discontinue the ambient air monitoring program at the 
Wayne-Rosedale Sour Gas Plant.  

Deadline for submission of Statments of Concern is October 6, 2016.
PRIM_APPLICANT_ADDRESS1: 250 6 Ave SW Suite 1110 c/o Alvarez & Marsal

tcngramm_X3b_en_body:
Syncrude Canada Ltd has submitted an application under Specified Enactments (Environmental Protection and Enhancement Act) for a renewal of an existing approval for the two active and operationally integrated sites (Mildred Lake and Aurora North Oil Sands Processing Plant and Mine). The two sites are located in Townships 91 to 94 Ranges 10 to 12 (Mildred Lake), and Township 96 Ranges 9 to 11 (Aurora North), all west of the 4th Meridian. The operation consists of open-pit mines with on-site bitumen extraction and upgrading, which currently produces approximately 331,500 barrels per day of upgraded crude oil.

The application was received on December 22, 2016 and was not registered until January 12, 2017

Please note that this notice will expire after 30 days. However, a second notice for this application will be posted under Notices on the AER website until February 27, 2017, which is the deadline for submitting a statement of concern. 

The deadline for submitting a statement of concer

Syncrude Canada Ltd has submitted an application under the Specified Enactments (Environmental Protection and Enhancement Act) for an amendment to an existing approval to expand the approved Footprint of the Aurora North Oilsands Mine to include a small area to allow widening of a haulroad. The area being requested is less than 1ha in size and is located between two reclamation stockpiles and the only activity requested is tree-clearing.

The deadline for submitting a statement of concern is November 10, 2017.

Syncrude has applied under OSCA, EPEA, and the Water Act to amend the OSCA scheme footprint, the EPEA approval boundary, and the Water Act fenceline for the Aurora North Oil Sands Mine to include the West 1 (W1) common boundary pillar. The pillar extends about 3 kilometres (km) west of the Aurora North mine plant site and about 200 metres (m) south of the current lease boundary and is located in Sections 33 to 35, Township 95, Range 10, West of the 4th Meridian.

The applications are being made in response to a lease boundary optimization agreement between Syncrude and Canadian Natural Resources Ltd. (CNRL) on behalf of Canadian Natural Upgrading Ltd. (CNUL).

Manitok Energy Inc. has submitted an application under the Environmental Protection and Enhancement Act for an amendment to an existing approval to change the ownership of the Wayne-Rosedale Sour Gas Plant located in LSD 8 of Section 20 Township 28 Range 21 West of the 4th Meridian (approximately 15 km southwest of Drumheller) to Persist Oil and Gas Inc.
PRIM_APPLICANT_ADDRESS1: 250 6 Ave SW Suite 1110 c/o Alvarez & Marsal

tcngramm_X3b_en_body: Amend or renew a previously granted EPEA approval.

Syncrude Canada Ltd has submitted an application under the Environmental Protection and Enhancement Act for an amendment of their existing approval for the Mildred Lake/Aurora North and South Oil Sands Mine. The application is to amend the Athabasca River release criteria.

The deadline for Statements of Concern is May 20, 2020.
Amend or renew a previously granted EPEA approval.

Syncrude has applied for regulatory approval to construct, operate and reclaim the MLX project. The company is requesting amendments to its existing approvals under section 13 of the OSCA (AER Approval No. 8573), sections 66 and 70 of EPEA (EPEA Approval No. 26-02), and sections 42 and 54 of the Water Act (Water Act Approval No. 263298), as well as a licence under section 50 of the Water Act.
The project is to consist of two additional mining areas and affiliated perimeter features within and adjacent to the current operating and approved mining areas in accordance with the applications. It includes an extension of the existing Water Act fenceline and proposed diversion of an additional 11 700 000 m3 of water per year from the McKay River watershed through collection of on-site precipitation and runoff, groundwater seepage, dewatering, and basal water sands depressurization.
The MLX project is designed to sustain bitumen production levels at the Mildred Lake facility after depletion of

Syncrude Canada Ltd has submitted an application under the Environmental Protection and Enhancement Act for an amendment to an existing approval to correct the definitions of fluid tailings and tailings that were included in a previous approval.

Syncrude Canada Ltd has submitted an application under the Environmental Protection and Enhancement Act for an amendment to an exiting approval to reduce the required cover thickness of suitable overburden or tailings sand from the prescribed 1.0 metres (m) to 0.3 m of suitable overburden, for lean oil sand substrates only. This amendment application pertains to the Mildred Lake/Aurora North Oil Sands Project.

Syncrude has applied under the WA (008-00263298 and 001-00466043) and EPEA (053-26) to construct and operate the Dover River Channel and Outfall northwest of the Mildred Lake Extension West (MLX-W) mine site. The channel and outfall being proposed is an optimized interception run-on channel system that would replace the approved, but not yet constructed, northwest interception channel that would have discharged into the MacKay River. The proposed channel system would redirect intercepted run-on water around the mine site 

Syncrude has also applied to amend the activities listed in an existing WA approval since the company no longer intends to construct the northwest interception channel.

Twin Butte Energy Ltd. has applied for an amendment to extend the expiry date of their current approval under EPEA for the Provost (Hansman Lake) Sour Gas Plant facility.

Received date is July 6, 2015
PRIM_APPLICANT_ADDRESS1: c/o FTI Consulting Canada Inc, 720, 440-2nd Ave SW

tcngramm_X3b_en_body: Bow River Energy Ltd. has submitted an application under the Environmental Protection and Enhancement Act to transfer the approval for the Hansman Lake Sour Gas Plant to Surge Energy Inc.
Amend or renew a previously granted EPEA approval.

Persist Oil and Gas Inc. has submitted an application under the Environmental Protection and Enhancement Act for an amendment of their existing approval of the Wayne-Rosedale Sour Gas Plant. The amendment is to request an extension of the approval expiry date.
Amend or renew a previously granted EPEA approval.
Amend or renew a previously granted EPEA approval.

Syncrude has applied under the OSCA, EPEA and Water Act, to infill a section of the Stanley Creek Valley at its Aurora North oil sands mine site. The activity is required to further develop the Fort Hills Dump overburden storage area up to the infilling area. The location of the Stanley Creek infilling activity is in Section 24 of Township 96, Range 10, and West of the 4th Meridian. The Syncrude Aurora North oil sands mine site is located approximately 80 km north of Fort McMurray.

Deadline for filing a statement of concern is November 20, 2017.
Amend or renew a previously granted EPEA approval.

Syncrude Canada Ltd has been issued an amendment to their Environmental Protection and Enhancement Approval for the Mildred Lake/Aurora North Oil Sands Processing Plant and Mine to adjust a reporting clause (2.2.1) and to remove condition 4.1.16 as Syncrude has specific clauses related to their pollution-abatement equipment that was inadvertantly included in the renewal approval (26-03-00).

The deadline for submission of Statements of Concern is November 13, 2020.

Syncrude Canada Ltd. has submitted an application under the Environmental Protection and Enhancement Act for an amendment to an existing approval to update clauses 4.1.3, 4.1.19, 4.1.26, 4.1.31, 4.1.38, 4.4 and 7.4.7 associated to the Mildred Lake mining project.

An application has been submitted for a consent to transfer the existing Environmental Protection and Enhancement Act approval of the Hansman Lake (Provost) Sour Gas Plant from Husky Oil Operations Limited to Bow River Energy Ltd. 

The deadline for submission of Statements of Concern is December 19, 2017.
PRIM_APPLICANT_ADDRESS1: PO Box 6525 Stn D, 707 - 8 Ave SW

tcngramm_X3b_en_body: Syncrude Canada Ltd has submitted an application under Specified Enactments (Environmental Protection and Enhancement Act) to extend the expiry date of the approval for the Mildred Lake/Aurora North and South Oil Sands Mine. The extension will allow time for the Alberta Energy Regulator to review the renewal application.

Husky Oil Operations Limited has applied for a renewal approval for the Provost Sour Gas Plant for the processing of natural gas, and has a maximum feed rate of 424,000 cubic metres per day. The plant is located in SE 08-14-40-03-W4M.
PRIM_APPLICANT_ADDRESS1: PO Box 6525 Stn D, 707 - 8 Ave SW

tcngramm_X3b_en_body: Manitok Energy Inc. has submitted an application under the Environmental Protection and Enhancement Act for an amendment to an existing approval to change approval holder name from EnCana Corporation to Manitok Energy Inc. The approval pertains to the Wayne-Rosedale Sour Gas Plant located in LSD 8 of Section 20 Township 28 Range 21 West of the 4th Meridian (approximately 15 km southwest of Drumheller).

Syncrude has applied under OSCA and EPEA to construct, operate, and reclaim the NE5 reclamation material stockpile (RMS) at its Aurora North oil sands mine site, located about 80 kilometres north of Fort McMurray. The RMS would occupy about 16 hectares in Section 24, Township 96, Range 10, West of the 4th Meridian. The RMS would be in use for an estimated 33 years, with final reclamation expected in 2052.

The deadline for filing a statement of concern is February 5, 2018.

Twin Butte Energy Ltd. has applied for a renewal of their existing Environmental Protection and Enhancement Act approval for the decommissioned Hansman Lake Sour Gas Plant.

Deadline for submitting Statements of Concern is October 10, 2015
PRIM_APPLICANT_ADDRESS1: c/o FTI Consulting Canada Inc, 720, 440-2nd Ave SW

tcngramm_X3b_en_body: Syncrude Canada Ltd has submitted an application under the Environmental Protection and Enhancement Act for an amendment to an existing approval to conduct a commercial demonstration of the fluid fine tailings (FFT) overburden clay (Kc) treatment technology (co-mix) with the W4 overburden storage facility. There are no geotechnical or environmental concerns regarding the construction of this demonstration and the demonstration will not result in changes to Syncrude's reclamation and closure plans.

Syncrude has applied under OSCA, EPEA, the Water Act, and the Public Lands Act to expand the Fort Hills overburden dump and construct a reclamation material stockpile (RMS) at its Aurora North oil sands mine site, located about 80 kilometres north of Fort McMurray. The expansion of the Fort Hills overburden dump will occupy about 78 hectares (ha), while the RMS will occupy about 205 ha. The activities will be in Legal Subdivisions 116, Section 25, Township 96, Range 10, West of the 4th Meridian, and all of Section 30-096-9W4M. The area of the activities will be in use for an estimated 47 years, with reclamation scheduled to start in 2053.

application for the renewal of a sour gas plant located in 1-20-28-21-W4M (15 km southwest of Drumheller). The purpose of this plant is to process sour solution gas into a saleable natural gas product. The facility includes gas sweetening and compression and is licensed for a raw gas capacity of 143 x ^3m^3/d. The acid gas by-product is re-injected into a disposal well.
Amend or renew a previously granted EPEA approval.
PRIM_APPLICANT_ADDRESS1: c/o FTI Consulting Canada Inc, 720, 440-2nd Ave SW

tcngramm_X3b_en_body:
Syncrude Canada Ltd. has submitted an application under the Environmental Protection and
Enhancement Act for an amendment to an existing approval to extend the surface disturbance footprint of the Syncrude Mildred Lake project beyond that currently defined by the limits of Mineral Surface Lease # 352 (MSL), for the purposes of constructing reclamation material stockpiles. The  proposed extension will be located in the SE 1/4 of Section 7, Sections 8, 9 and 10 Township 94 Range 11 West of the 4th Meridian (located north of the Mildred Lake site). The propoed W4N RMS will occupy approximately 724 ha. Storage of reclamation material in stockpiles is required to ensure material availability at closure.
Amend or renew a previously granted EPEA approval.
